enrolled-dateline.#text: Begun and held at the City of Washington on Thursday, the third day of January, two thousand and thirteen

congress.#text: One Hundred Thirteenth Congress of the United States of America

official-title.#text: To amend title 28, United States Code, to modify the composition of the southern judicial district of Mississippi to improve judicial efficiency, and for other purposes.

role.#text: Speaker of the House of Representatives.
Vice President of the United States and President of the Senate.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: , is amended to read as follows:

header.#text: Realignment of southern judicial district of Mississippi

continuation-text.#text: Court for the Northern Division shall be held at Jackson.
Court for the Southern Division shall be held at Gulfport.
Court for the Eastern Division shall be held at Hattiesburg.
Court for the Western Division shall be held at Natchez.

text.#text: The southern district comprises four divisions.

The Northern Division comprises the counties of Copiah, Hinds, Holmes, Issaquena, Kemper, Lauderdale, Leake, Madison, Neshoba, Newton, Noxubee, Rankin, Scott, Simpson, Sharkey, Smith, Warren, and Yazoo.
The Southern Division comprises the counties of George, Greene, Hancock, Harrison, Jackson, Pearl River, and Stone.
The Eastern Division comprises the counties of Clarke, Covington, Forrest, Jasper, Jefferson Davis, Jones, Lamar, Lawrence, Marion, Perry, Wayne, and Walthall.
The Western Division comprises the counties of Adams, Amite, Claiborne, Franklin, Jefferson, Lincoln, Pike, and Wilkinson.
This Act and the amendment made by this Act shall take effect on the date of the enactment of this Act.

{http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/}title.#text: HR 2871 ENR: To amend title 28, United States Code, to modify the composition of the southern judicial district of Mississippi to improve judicial efficiency, and for other purposes.
